intro.title: full stack web development
intro.summary: Detail-oriented interactive events and experiences professional with a track record of seeing multidimensional projects from conception to completion, coordinating all aspects of production — including R&D, prototyping, partnerships, marketing, budgeting, and logistics — to create powerful, engaging, and enlightening experiences.
achievements: Led production of 40+ gaming events with 3800+ attendance, including escape rooms and events at gaming conventions such as GEN CON and PAX.
Led or collaborated with over 20 cross-disciplinary teams on creative projects in gaming, edtech, marketing, and immersive design.
Contracted to produce games, puzzles, and quizzes for proprietary digital platforms that have seen play by thousands of users.

endorsements.name: Jenny Gottstein
endorsements.title: Director of Games at The Go Game
endorsements.quote: A dream to work with—clever, resourceful, proactive, and professional. Even under tight deadlines and difficult parameters, his creative output far surpassed expectations.

endorsements.name: Raul Carvajal
endorsements.title: Festival Producer at Games for Change
endorsements.quote: A detail-oriented team player who thrives in collaborative environments with a proactive attitude on organizational development, always searching for ways to increase efficiency and output to match the needs of large productions.

endorsements.name: Colin Lestrange
endorsements.title: HireOwl Co-Founder
endorsements.quote: Led our user growth efforts and helped position the company for long-term success. I'd recommend him to any organization in search of a strategic thinker with excellent problem solving skills.

interests: Regular presenter at conferences on live action gaming events, conflict sims, and interactive media — including talks and workshops at Serious Play, GEN CON, NYU, CUNY, Rutgers, Brooklyn College, and The New School.
Occasional adventurer with experience in foreign cultures and untamed wilds, including treks to Mt. Kilimanjaro and Mount Everest Base Camp.

experience.title: Interactive Event Producer
experience.summary: Led production of 40+ gaming events with 3800+ attendance, including escape rooms and events at gaming conventions such as GEN CON and PAX.

bullets.text: Led the design, development, and execution of over 40 live events for 3800+ total attendees, ranging from escape rooms and wedding receptions to geopolitical simulations and team-building events.
Assembled and led teams of multi-disciplinary professionals to produce and run complex gaming events at 8 major conventions and expos, regularly selling out.
Specialist in interactive, gamified events using narrative and theme to achieve event objectives within given space, time, and budgetary constraints.
Contracted by 5 companies (to-date) to produce games, puzzles, and quizzes for live events and proprietary digital platforms, resulting in successful products experienced by thousands of players.
Built relationships with top-tier media influencers in tabletop gaming, leading to product plugs and positive reviews in 10+ podcasts and on YouTube.

On strength of event offerings at 2019 gaming conventions, invited to run events at Gen Con 2020, securing a 200,000 square foot space. (Planning was well underway when the convention was cancelled due to COVID-19.)
5 years spent balancing multiple creative projects, in addition to business development, branding, marketing, social media, budgeting, etc.

experience.title: Production Coordinator
experience.summary: Collaborated on a cross-functional team to produce the 2019 G4C Festival with attendance of over 1200.

bullets.text: Coordinated work of 12 junior producers, event team members, and ‘super-volunteers’ during 7 day pre-Festival production sprint.

Oversaw production of Festival collateral including website and program content, session descriptions, press releases, speaker bios, sponsor/partner assets, etc., serving as final checkpoint for content accuracy and quality.

Recruited, trained 150 volunteers, maintaining motivation and engagement over 2 months through email outreach, digital meet-ups, and live events, resulting in smallest volunteer falloff of any G4C Festival.
Managed volunteer teams (organized into over 500 shifts and 10 distinct roles) throughout the Festival, allocating personnel, overseeing output, and problem solving as necessary.

experience.title: Project Manager / E-Learning Product Designer
experience.summary: Career guidance and ESL startup based in China. Recruited as Project Manager; transitioned to product design and development role in early 2018. (Changing geopolitical situation led to closure of US office.)

bullets.text: Collaborated with curriculum lead to oversee team of 16 remote developers, resulting in creation of over 200 interactive ESL lessons on the Articulate web-learning platform.
Produced 24 ‘concept’ lessons (and supporting documentation) featuring complex gamification and narrative design for POC demonstration to financiers and other stakeholders.
Served as final check on lessons, documentation, and other collateral for accuracy, functionality, and adherence to SOPs before delivery.
Managed and mentored 26 junior analysts on multiple teams to produce 7 50-100 page equity and market research reports.

experience.title: Manager, Operations + Development
experience.summary: Worked closely with founders of this small edtech startup; involved in all aspects of the business.

bullets.text: Used market research, user surveys, A/B tests, and case studies to iterate and refine platform features, and prioritize development given budget and time limits.
Oversaw and coordinated work of 3 remote front and back-end developers and designers, including 3 major feature updates, a rebrand/front-end overhaul, and numerous minor updates.
Worked with founders to build partnerships with career centers at over 40 schools, growing active student user base to over 30,000.

Recruited and managed team of 15 students to source and begin outreach to 3,300 key decision makers at more than 1,000 colleges and universities, ultimately bringing 12 new institutions to the platform.
Spearheaded coworking space outreach, resulting in partnerships with 5 offices in NYC and Boston.

experience.title: Producer, Live + Online Events
experience.summary: Short-term position at the Noise4Good startup, intended as a web-platform for musicians to host digital fundraising campaigns for nonprofit organizations. Responsibilities included product management, digital and live events, branding, and whatever else needed doing.

bullets.text: Gathered and organized survey results from 200+ users as well as engagement metrics and feedback from stakeholders, producing a detailed report for 4GoodDigital founders and development team.
Oversaw 7 day development sprint (including UI updates and bug fixes) and managed launch of 3 POC digital campaigns, raising over $4,000 for charity.

Produced 5 intimate gatherings for strategic partners, investors (both onboard and prospective), and musicians, featuring live performances and product demos at high-end venues and coworking spaces, with total attendance of over 250.
